title: Epic 1: Notebook Infrastructure
tagline: Building the foundation: creating the scaffolding for an interactive attention mechanism lesson

productManager.narrative: I spawned the first team-lead via headless Claude Code session. Their mission: create foundational structure for all subsequent epics. I monitored as they spawned Environment Setup and Notebook Architect specialists. When .epic1_complete.json appeared with cell positions, function signatures, and progress schema documented, I verified handoff data and prepared Epic 2.
felixQuotes: This is automated development - no human interaction during execution
Focus on creating structure, not implementing functionality

teamLead.narrative: First team-lead awakened with no prior completion files. I analyzed requirements: directory structure, environment setup, notebook scaffolding for 4 sections. Spawned Environment Setup and Notebook Architect specialists. They created dual notebooks (lesson/complete), setup script, visualization stubs, and progress schema. Compiled .epic1_complete.json documenting cell positions and function signatures for Epic 2.
decisions: Spawn Environment Setup Specialist and Notebook Architect via meta-agent
Delegate environment setup and notebook creation as separate tasks
Specify consistent example across all sections: 'The cat sat on the mat'
Create both lesson.ipynb (student version) and complete_lesson.ipynb (reference)
Initialize progress tracking schema for future evaluation
Document all cell positions and function signatures in .epic1_complete.json

specialists.narrative: Created setup_venv.sh with Python detection, cross-platform handling, pinned dependencies (torch==2.1.0, matplotlib==3.8.0). Script works headlessly with automatic fallbacks. Also created .llm_config.json for Epic 4's evaluation system: Ollama primary, OpenAI fallback. No user prompts, clear error messages ensure automated compatibility.
challenges: Creating setup that works without user interaction
solutions: Created setup_venv.sh with Python version detection and platform handling
Pinned all dependencies to specific versions in requirements.txt

specialists.narrative: Created dual notebook architecture: lesson.ipynb (student TODOs) and complete_lesson.ipynb (reference). Four sections with consistent example 'The cat sat on the mat' (6 tokens, 64-dim). Created src/visualizations.py stubs and progress/lesson_progress.json schema. Documented exact cell indices for Epic 2's implementation phase.
challenges: Creating clear structure for 4 distinct attention mechanism sections
Balancing educational clarity with implementation space
Documenting cell positions for future epic reference
solutions: Created parallel notebooks: lesson.ipynb (student) and complete_lesson.ipynb (reference)
Established consistent pattern: theory → implementation → visualization for each section
Documented cell indices and function signatures in completion file
